title: Hugo Christiaan Hamaker
summary: Hugo Christiaan Hamaker (23 March 1905 in Broek op Langedijk, North Holland â€“ 7 September 1993 in Eindhoven) was a Dutch scientist, who was responsible for the Hamaker theory which explains the van der Waals forces between objects larger than molecules.  His 1937 paper was heavily cited.
